place.name: LITTLE CARLTON
place.gazetteerText: CARLTON (Little), a parish in Louth district, Lincoln; 2 miles E of Legbourne r. station, and 4½ ESE of Louth. Post Town, Carlton, under Louth. Acres, 1,006. Real property, £1,735. Pop., 181. Houses, 33. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in they diocese of Lincoln. Value, £159.* Patron, John Forster, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
